intro: Muellera laticifera, commonly known as the broad-veined muellera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Muellera laticifera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
